Identification_Area.title: IHW COMET HALLEY NEAR NUCLEUS IMAGE DATA, V2.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Sekanina, Zdenek (ed.), 'The Comet Halley Archive Summary Volume', Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena, California, JPL D-400-450, August 1991.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: IHW COMET HALLEY NEAR NUCLEUS IMAGE DATA, V2.0
Data_Set_PDS3.producer_full_name: GRAYZECK, E.J., KLINGLESMITH, D.A., III, NIEDNER, M.B., JR
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Larson, S.M., Z. Sekanina and J. Rahe, IHW COMET HALLEY NEAR NUCLEUS IMAGE DATA, V2.0, IHW-C-NNSN-3-EDR-HALLEY-V2.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 2006.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Detailed images of the nucleus of 1P/Halley colected by the IHW Near-Nucleus Studies Network over the period 1982-10-16 to 1989-04-12. This second version includes format updates and corrected errata.
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set presents images of the nucleus of comet 1P/Halley obtained by the various contributing observers of the International Halley Watch (IHW) Near-Nucleus Studies Network (NNSN) over the period 16 October 1982 to 12 April 1989. Observers around the world contributed to this data set, which consists of 3523 well-documented FITS images. The second version includes PDS format and standard updates, as well as correction of the various errata noted since the original publication.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This data set presents images of the nucleus of comet 1P/Halley obtained by the various contributing observers of the International Halley Watch (IHW) Near-Nucleus Studies Network (NNSN) over the period 16 October 1982 to 12 April 1989. Observers around the world contributed to this data set, which consists of 3523 well-documented FITS images.
The data are broken down into directories by year and month of observation. The NNSN used a standard reporting format for keywords in the FITS header. The images themselves are all either 2-byte or 4-byte integer data. Calibrated and uncalibrated data appear in the same directory.
Modification History ==================== Generation of the version 2.0 form of this data set consisted of the following:
o Concatenation of FITS headers and data segments to restore compliant FITS image files. No modifications were made to either FITS headers or FITS data segments.
o Generation of new PDS labels, incorporating as many keyword values and comments from the FITS file headers as possible.
o Sorting into monthly directories.
o Creation of a summary index file for all images.
o Application of the errata noted by Mikael Aronsson (JPL) as he compiled the IHW Printed Archive and Printed Archive Index.
o Correction (where possible) or notation directly in the labels of errata submitted by others since original publication.
o Correction of some minor FITS header syntax issues noted while working with the data files.
25 August 2006, A.C.Raugh
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note:
Confidence Level Overview ========================= A general data quality indicator was provided for each image in the FITS header, carried over into the PDS label in the keyword DATA_QUALITY_DESC. The four values of this keyword are EXCELLENT, GOOD, FAIR and POOR. Images rated POOR were included only when better data were not available for a particular date.
Users should consult 'The Comet Halley Archive Summary Volume' (JPL D-400-450) for a discussion of the completeness and of the collection and overall quality considerations.
